intro: Sebaea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and grows as a shrub or small tree. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. Sebaea macrophylla is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
